title.narrative: F.a: Institutionalizing social dialogue in the workplace

description.narrative: The project strengthens migrant workers? knowledge about trade union rights and enhances grassroots-level local trade union networks through trainings, workshops, meetings, information sharing events, as well as material production. In addition, through pu blic labor disputes migrant workers strive for effective advocacy which purpose is to ask the ACFTU to support open to collective bargaining processes and democratic elections of workers? representatives in workplaces in Guangdong Province.Currently in Chi na there is no freedom of association and right to collective bargaining and as a result, employees cannot freely choose their representatives and cannot negotiate with the employer's about terms of employment. Civil society organizations supporting migran t workers are trying to meet the needs which the Communist Party?s official trade union, ACFTU refrain by providing training and coaching to the workers' representatives to enable them to defend their rights through collective bargaining.The project increa ses grassroots-level organizing at the workplace level and creates new kinds of models to resolve labor disputes, and to institutionalize collective bargaining and democratic elections at workplaces. The project also encourages the ACFTU to reform its prac tices, to carry out democratic elections, and genuine collective bargaining in the workplaces.The beneficiaries of the project are industrial workers of the Guangdong province.
